summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and committing perjury during 2016 depositions. The document outlines the allegations against Maxwell, details her grooming and abuse tactics, and includes statements from law enforcement officials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing minors to travel for illegal sex acts and committing perjury in 2016 depositions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's co-conspirator in the sexual abuse of minor girls as young as 14, with Maxwell allegedly facilitating his abuse.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced the charges against Maxwell and made a statement condemning Maxwell's role in the abuse scheme.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Made a statement praising the victims' bravery and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Committed the NYPD to bringing justice to survivors of sexual assault in a statement.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Assigned to preside over Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell facilitating, grooming, and participating in the abuse of Epstein's victims.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority announcing the criminal charges against Maxwell.
Sweeney, as FBI Assistant Director, is part of the law enforcement team investigating and charging Maxwell.
Shea, as NYPD Commissioner, is part of the law enforcement team supporting the investigation and charges.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and a federal indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors with Jeffrey Epstein and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein exploited girls as young as 14, grooming and abusing them during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell is charged with perjury for making false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges Maxwell groomed victims as young as 14 by befriending them, taking them on trips, and normalizing sexual interactions with Epstein.
Maxwell is also charged with perjury for false statements made during 2016 depositions related to the abuse allegations.
The alleged abuse occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as Maxwell's residence in London.
The case is assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan and is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Public Corruption Unit.
